ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I would recommend the class.
The course will deepen your knowledge of economics theory and is the basis for other economics courses. It definitely worths taking.
If you are interested in mathematics, then yes.
This course is suitable for a grad student who has some basic knowledge on microeconomics.

Yes, definetly I recommend this course to others. The course is different from any of the textbook I know and quite unique in the sense that every topic in the lecture is closely connected with Michal Boozer's thinking style. I really liked the expansion/applicatioin of consumer theory to the saving decision and labor market issues.
Master level microeconomics. No surprises. Recommended!
i would recommend it to a student that he hasnt done economics and macroeconomics before.

Economics 545 not only solidifies the foundations of microeconomics, but also allowed one to appreciate some of those concepts via applications.Yes, I would recommend this course to another student because it teaches microeconomic concepts so that one could apply them and further appreciate them.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learned a tremendous amount in this class and I have a much deeper understanding for microeconomics after taking the course.
It helps me refresh my memory about microeconomic theory.
It helped me to understand economics theory more deeply. I now can relate the course content with some realistic policy issue
Yes. It is more to the applied side of microeconomics, which will be useful for my future work as an economist.
What I learned especially in the part of consumer theory would facilitate me to analyze any of the economics relevanet issues, not only microecoomics but macro or some other social science topics.
Builds on and extent my previous knowlegde very effectively.Good course!
This course taught me micreconomics so that I appreciate the concepts and fundamentals of it.
